instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Lines on screen
threads.message:
Works perfectly except for the screen. 
* Lines on screen when booted
* No lines during boot
* Doesn't boot with an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/2017 screen
* No test screen available

Behaviour does not change when moving the screen cables / moving the screen, so flexgate not likely(?).

During boot:
[ATTACH type="full" width="427px"]60428[/ATTACH]

Booted:
[ATTACH type="full" width="429px"]60429[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Lines on screen
threads.message:
I had the same issue before with screen lines.
Resolved by replacing the screen.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Lines on screen
threads.message: If external video is good, then bad screen.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> / <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>- Lines on screen
threads.message: Checked external video, that's fine. Assuming cable replacement is not worth a try, will return as no fix. Thanks!
